intro: Plagiobothrys figuratus subsp. corallicarpus, commonly known as the coral fruit plagiobothrys, is a flowering plant native to southern California. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces distinctive, coral-like fruits that are edible and have a mild, sweet flavor. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal scrub environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
